title: Quiz 1 - Simple Interest
instruction: Given below are two quantities named I & II. Based on the given information, you have to determine the relation between the two quantities.

quiz.text: A sum of money doubles itself in 10 years at simple rate of interest. In how many years would it become 5 times of itself?
options: 40 years
30 years
35 years
42 years
None of these

quiz.text: A man buys some land and pays 20 times of its annual rent. What will be rate of interest?
options: 8%
12%
5 %
20%
10%

quiz.text: A father left a wealth of Rs. 68,000 to be divided between two sons aged 10 years and 12 years such that they may get equal amount when each attains the age of 18 years. If the money is reckoned at 10% per annum. What was the difference between the amount each received?
options: 4000
5000
4500
3500
None of these

quiz.text: Find the minimum number of complete years such that the interest on RS. 106.25 @3% p.a. will be in exact no. of Rupees.
options: 16 years
14 years
10 years
12 years
None of these

quiz.text: A man borrowed Rs. 3500 from two money lenders. For one loan, he paid 5% p.a. and for the other, he paid 10% p.a.  The total interest paid for two years was Rs. 500. How much did he borrow at 10%?
options: Rs. 1000
Rs 1200
Rs. 2000
Rs 1500
None of these

quiz.text: A person borrows Rs. 5000 for 99 years at 4% per annum . He immediately lends it to another person at 6.25% per annum for 99 years. Find his gain in transaction per year.
options: Rs 100
Rs 112.5
Rs. 120
Rs. 110.5
None of these

quiz.text: Two equal sums of money were invested, one at 4% and other at 4.1%. At the end of 99 years, SI received from the latter exceeded to that received from the former by Rs. 198. What was each sum amount to?
options: Rs 1500
Rs. 2300
Rs. 1000
Rs. 2100
Rs 2000

quiz.text: Ram borrowed some money at 6% per annum for first three years, 9% per annum for the next five years & 13 % per annum for the period beyond eight years. If the total interest paid by him at the end of 11 years is Rs. 81600. How much money did he borrow?
options: Rs 70000
Rs. 120000
Rs 80000
Rs. 50000
Rs. 100000

quiz.text: Anjali claims to be lending money at Simple rate of Interest, but she includes the interest every six months for calculating the principle. If she is charging an interest of 20% half yearly, What will be the EFFECTIVE Rate of Interest?
options: 52.5%
56.25%
21%
44%
None of these

quiz.text: SI on certain sum is  of the sum. What will be the rate of interest if the interest Rate and time are equal?
options: 10%
15%
8%
20%
12%

quiz.text: Anjali invested certain amount in three different schemes A, B and C with the rate of interest 10% per annum, 12% per annum and 15% per annum respectively. If the total interest accrued in one year was Rs. 3200 and the amount invested in scheme C was 150% of the amount invested in Scheme A and 240% of the amount invested in scheme B, what was the amount invested in Scheme B?
options: Rs 6000
Rs. 8000
Rs. 4000
Rs 10,000
None of these

quiz.text: What sum of money will amount to Rs. 520 in five years and to Rs. 568 in 7 years at SI?
options: Rs. 300
Rs 400
Rs. 500
Rs. 600
Rs. 1000

quiz.text: If simple interest on Rs. 600 increases by Rs. 30 when the rate of interest increases by 4% per annum, find the time.
options: 1
1
2
2 years
None of these

quiz.text: If a sum of Rs. 1600 is divided into two such parts that the simple interest on the first part for two and half years at the rate of 4% per annum equals the simple interest on the second part for 5 years at the rate of 3 % p.a., then find the difference between the parts?.
options: Rs. 220
Rs. 280
Rs. 300
Rs. 320
None of these

quiz.text: Out of certain sum, one-third is invested at 3% , one-sixth at 6% and the rest at 8%. If the annual income is Rs. 300, then what will be the original sum?
options: Rs. 4000
Rs. 5000
Rs. 6000
Rs. 8000
Rs. 4500

quiz.text: A person invested some amount at the rate of 12% simple interest and a certain amount at the rate of 10% simple interest. He received yearly interest of Rs. 130. But if he had interchanged the amounts invested, he would have received Rs. 4 more as interest. How much did he invest in the 12% simple interest?
options: Rs. 700
Rs. 500
Rs. 900
Rs. 400
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 2,189 are divided into three parts such that interest on them after 1, 2, and 3 years, respectively may be equal, the rate of simple interest being 4% per annum in all cases. What is the value of the smallest part?
options: Rs. 298
Rs. 348
Rs. 398
Rs. 248
Rs. 389

quiz.text: A sum was put at simple interest at a certain rate for 2 years. Had it been at 1% higher rate, it would have fetched Rs. 24 more. What is the sum?
options: Rs. 1000
Rs. 1200
Rs. 1500
Rs. 2000
None of these

quiz.text: Katappa invests an amount of Rs. 15,680 in names of his three daughters  A, B and C in such a way that they get equal simple interest after 2, 3, and 4 years respectively. If the rate of simple interest is 5% p.a., then What will be the ratio of the amounts invested among A, B and C?
options: 6 : 4 : 3
6 : 4 : 2
7 : 5 : 3
6 : 3 : 4
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of Rs. 18750 is left by will by a father to be divided between two sons, 12 and 14 years of age, so that when they attain maturity at 18,  the amount(P + I)  received by each at 5% simple interest will be the same. Find the sum allotted at present to younger son.
options: Rs. 9000
Rs. 18,000
Rs. 12,000
Rs. 10,000
Rs. 15,000

quiz.text: The simple interest of a certain sum P at 5% for 9 months is greater than the simple interest on the same sum at the rate of 3% for 14 months. What is the sum of interest in both the cases ?
options: Rs.
Rs.
Rs.
Rs.
None of these

quiz.text: A sum of Rs. 1440 is lent out in three parts in such a way that the interest on first part at 2% for 3  years, second part at 3% for 4 years and third part at 4% for 5 years are equal. What will be the difference between the largest and the smallest sum?
options: Rs. 560
Rs. 1309
Rs. 1500
Rs. 1200
None of these

quiz.text: An article marked price of which  Rs. 9000 is sold at a discount which is equal to the simple interest on Rs. 3000 for N months. Find the value of N if the rate of discount is the same as the rate of interest.
options: 24 months
32 months
30 months
36 months
None of these

quiz.text: A borrows Rs. 800 at the rate of 12% per annum SI and B borrows Rs. 910 at the rate of 10% per annum SI, after how many years their amount of debt will be equal?
options: 20 years
21 years
22 years
24 years
None of these

quiz.text: Devsena invests Rs. 3,965 in the names of her three daughters Neeta, Sita and Gita in such a way that  they get the same amount after 2,3 and 4 years, respectively. If the rate of interest is 5% per annum, what will be the ratio of amount invested for her three daughters Neeta, Sita and Gita ?
options: 256 : 264 : 283
76 : 64 : 53
276 : 264:253
23 : 17 : 13
None of these

quiz.text: A certain sum is invested for T years. It amounts to Rs. 400 at 10% per annum. But when invested at 4% per annum, it amounts to Rs. 200. Find the time (T).
options: 50 years
60 years
45 years
75 years
40 years

quiz.text: Divide Rs. 6000 into two parts, so that simple interest on the first part for 2 years at 6% p.a. may be equal to the simple interest on the second part for three years at 8% per annum. What is the difference between the amounts?
options: Rs. 1000
Rs. 1100
Rs. 1200
Rs. 1250
Rs. 2000

quiz.text: A trader owes a merchant Rs. 10028 due 1 year, hence the trader wants to settle the account after 3 months. If the rate of interest is 12% per annum, approximately how much cash should he pay?
options: Rs. 9000
Rs. 9225
Rs. 8750
Rs. 9500
None of these

quiz.text: What should be the least number of years in which  Rs. 2600 at  6 % simple interest will be an exact whole number?
options: 3
3.5
4
2
None of these

quiz.text: Rs. 1,500 is invested at a rate of 10% simple interest and interest is added to the principle after every 5 years. In how many years will it amount to Rs. 2500?
options: 6 years
55 years
10/9 years
None of these

quiz.text: Mahesh borrowed Rs. 3000 from his friend Suresh at 15% per annum for 3 years. Find the money returned by Mahesh to Suresh?
options: Rs. 4400
None of these
Rs. 4000
Rs. 4500
Rs. 4350

quiz.text: A man lends a certain sum of money at simple interest. Rate of interest for first one and half years is 6% per annum, for next 9 months is 5% per annum and after that 4% per annum. If he received Rs. 11496 at the end of 4 years, what was his capital?
options: Rs. 9600
Rs. 9400
Rs. 9000
Rs. 8500
None of these

quiz.text: Simple interest on a sum of money is 1/9th of the principle and the number of years is equal to the rate per annum. What is the rate percent per annum?
options: 5%
7%
3%
3.33%
None of these

quiz.text: A milkman borrowed Rs. 3500 from two money lenders. For one loan, he paid 5% p.a. and for the other, he paid 10% p.a.  The total interest paid for two years was Rs. 500. How much did he borrow at 10% rate?
options: Rs. 500
Rs. 1000
Rs. 1800
Rs. 2000
Rs. 1500

quiz.text: Akbar lends twice the interest received from Birbal to Chanakya at the half of the interest at which he lent to Birbal. If Akbar lent Rs. P at r% interest per annum for one year to Birbal then, what is the interest received by Akbar from Chanakya?
options: Rs.  P
Rs.  P
Rs. 2 P
Rs.  P
None of these

quiz.text: Scheme A offers simple interest at a certain rate of interest (p.c.p.a.). If the difference between the interest earned by Ashok and Priya from scheme A after 4 yrs. is Rs. 4436.520, what is the rate of interest (p.c.p.a.)?
options: 85.8%
23%
16.5%
25%
54%

quiz.text: What is the ratio of the total amount invested by Ashok in schemes C and E together to the total amount invested by Priya in the same schemes together?
options: 31:44
37:41
54:12
54:48
29:85

quiz.text: If scheme D offers compound interest (compounded half-yearly) at interest rate of 16% p.a. What would be sum of interest earned by Ashok and Priya from scheme D after 1 year?
options: Rs. 25820
Rs 7565
Rs 7452
9984
7585

quiz.text: The scheme C offers compound interest (compounded annually) at an interest rate of 12% p.a. What is the difference between the interests earned by Ashok and Priya from scheme C after 2 years?
options: Rs 1628.16
Rs 587.38
Rs 7857.74
Rs 5425.58
Rs 7886.96

quiz.text: What is the average amount invested by Ashok in schemes A, B, C, D and E together?
options: Rs 29248
Rs56878
Rs 7855
Rs 78681
Rs 2213

quiz.text: If Anirban earned Rs. 2000 as simple interest from the money he invested for 2 years then find how much more money as interest he would have earned if he invested the sum in compound interest with same rate of interest and period?
options: Rs. 70
Rs. 120
Rs. 75
Rs. 80
None of these

quiz.text: If Priyanka invested Rs 20000 for the time given above but after 3 years she withdrew half of the sum invested due to urgent need then find how much less money she got as interest? (Assume there is no penalty for early withdrawal)
options: 800
454
600
650
None of these

quiz.text: If the interest earned by Amrita and Sraboni are equal then find the time for which Sraboni invested her money?
options: 4
1.5
2.5
Cant be determined
None of these

quiz.text: The total interest earned by Anirban and Priyanka is Rs. 15600 and the money invested by Anirban is twice the money invested by Priyanka who invested Rs. 25000 then find the time for which Anirban invested?
options: 2.4 yrs
3 yrs
1.2 yrs
3.2 yrs
None of these

quiz.text: Find the rate of interest received by Sraboni if she invested the sum 2 years and got Rs. 260 less as interest than Amrita got for her investment.
options: 3.6%
2.9%
4.4%
5%
None of these

quiz.text:
Quantity I The total income from the two investments. A part of Rs 9600 is invested at a 5% annual return, while the remainder is invested at a 3% annual return. If the annual interest from both portions is the same.

Quantity II The difference between the largest and the smallest sum . A Sum of Rs 1440 is lent out in three parts in such a way that the interests on first part at 2% for 3 years, second part at 3% for 4 years and third part at 4% for 5 years are equal.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text: Quantity I: Money invested at 5% p.a? A person derives an annual income of Rs. 688.25 from Rs. 10,000 invested partly at 8% p.a. and partly at 5% p.a. simple interest. Quantity II: Money lent at 12%? A sum of Rs. 2540 is lent out into two parts, one at 12% and the other at 12.5%. Total income is Rs. 311.60.
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
Shamita took a loan at simple interest rate of 6 p.c.p.a. in the first year and it increased by 1.5 p.c.p.a. every year. If she pays Rs. 8,190 as interest at the end of 3 years.

Quantity 1-  Shamitas loan amount?

Quantity 2- Rs. 35900
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation

quiz.text:
A certain amount earns simple interest of Rs. 1,750/ - after 7 years. Had the interest been 2% more, He would have earned Rs. more.

Quantity 1-

Quantity 2-  Rs. 258
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation can be established

quiz.text: A sum of money at simple interest amounts to Rs. 14,160 in 3 years. If the rate of interest is increased by 25%, the same sum amounts to Rs. 14,700 in the same time. Quantity1 - The rate of interest. Quantity 2- 6%
options: Quantity I > Quantity II
Quantity I < Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I Quantity II
Quantity I = Quantity II or No relation can be established
